Literature Review: The following references are selected based on their relevance to the topic of psychological safety, leadership, work experience, learning behavior, and performance. These studies provide a comprehensive overview of the established literature on psychological safety and its implications in various organizational contexts.

References.authors: Amy C. Edmondson, Mark Mortensen, and Michael L. Johnson
References.title: Teaming: How Organizations Learn, Innovate, and Compete in the Knowledge Economy

References.authors: Amy C. Edmondson, Richard B. Bohmer, and Gary P. Pisano
References.title: Disrupted Routines: Team Learning and New Technology Implementation in Hospitals

References.authors: Jing Zhou, John R. Hollenbeck, and David J. Johnson
References.title: The Role of Psychological Safety in Team Learning and Performance: A Meta-Analysis

References.authors: Erik van Knippenberg, Daan van Knippenberg, and Annebel H.B. Schouten
References.title: Transformational Leadership and Team Innovation: Integrating Team Climate Principles

References.authors: Kristin L. Neff and Gerardo Ramirez
References.journal: Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
References.title: Self-Compassion: An Alternative Conceptualization of Positive Self-Regard

References.authors: David A. Waldman, Michael D. Antino, and Michael D. Peterson
References.title: The Role of Authentic Leadership in the Development of an Ethical Organizational Culture: A Longitudinal Investigation

References.authors: Jing Zhou, John R. Hollenbeck, and David J. Johnson
References.title: The Role of Psychological Safety in Team Learning and Performance: A Meta-Analysis
